description: This is the second of a two term sequence in electrical and systems engineering senior design. Student work will focus on completing the design undertaken in ESE 450 and successfully implementing the project. Success will be verified using experimental and/or simulation methods appropriate to the project that test the degree to which the project objectives are achieved. Each project team will prepare a posted to support a final project presentation and demonstration to peers, faculty and external judges. Teh coruse will conclude with the submission of a final project written team report. During the semester there will be periodic project reviews with individual teams.
name: SR DESIGN PROJ II-EE/SSE

values.comments: ESE451 is the second semester of Electrical and Systems Engineering senior design. This class focuses on helping students complete their design undertaken in ESE450 and implementing their project. At the end of the semester, each team will prepares a final presentation to explain their project and provide a demonstration to peers, faculty, and external judge.   Overall, students reported struggling with the class, understanding that it was “of course... an open-ended course, so the time spent is open to the student” but they felt that what they got “was a class largely designed to fill time.” Many students strongly felt that “ESE senior design needs to be re-evaluated” and that the course “should focus on the quality and difficulty of the project and not just trying to get a product to sell out the door.”   Students were generally upset with Professor Laker, reporting that he “[did] not provide any useful feedback on projects” and finding that he routinely gave them a “hard time.” Many felt that the course content and the professor’s teaching style were both out of date. One specific concern was the “unnecessary” focus on keeping project notebooks. Students felt that “project notebooks are an archaic form of preserving intellectual property” and that Professor Laker failed to realize this.   This course is taken during the Spring semester of an undergraduate Electrical Engineering major’s senior year. Students reported struggling with the amount of work, expressing hope for “a way [to] alleviate some of the stress from this course.”

Students felt that “project notebooks are an archaic form of preserving intellectual property” and that Professor Laker failed to realize this.   This course is taken during the Spring semester of an undergraduate Electrical Engineering major’s senior year. Students reported struggling with the amount of work, expressing hope for “a way [to] alleviate some of the stress from this course.”
